titleStmt.title: Whereas we are informed, that the number of tories and robbers in the province of Ulster, and some other parts of this kingdom is much increased, notwithstanding many proclamations from this board for apprehending of divers tories, and they are of late grown much more bloody than formerly they have been, so that several robberies, burglaries and murthers are daily committed by them ... by the Lord Lieutenant and Council, Ormonde.
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Lieutenant (1677-1685 : Ormonde)
Ormonde, James Butler, Duke of, 1610-1688.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Benjamin Took and John Crook ... and are to be sold by Mary Crook ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 11 lines of text.
Statement of responsibility transposed from head of title.
"Given at the Council-chamber in Dublin the 26. day of March 1679"--leaf [2]
Reproduction of original in the Society of Antiquaries Library, London.
